page.title: 10A Farmer's Day.
page.content: The day starts at 6 a.m.in the early summer. There are calves to feed and the poultry to let out and feed. This is a job shared by husband and wife. Next the dairy herd are brought up from the fields for milking.By the time the cows are milked and the parlour swilled and cleaned it is 10.30 a.m. and time for a cooked breakfast. At this time of year there is silage to cut and make and the hay to be baled and stored. Silage making continues until it is dark. The farmer's wife is busy cleaning eggs and preparing poultry for customers, before doing her normal household chores. By early evening the cows must be milked again. It is a hard life. The farmer's wife said ,"You need to be brought up to it but I wouldn't change a thing."
